title: Geography
description: Maps, coordinates, continents, oceans, and countries.

questions.prompt: What is the imaginary line at 0° latitude called?
questions.explanation: The equator is the circle of latitude at 0°, dividing Earth into Northern and Southern Hemispheres.

questions.prompt: What is the imaginary line at 0° longitude called?
questions.explanation: The Prime Meridian (Greenwich meridian) is defined as 0° longitude.

questions.prompt: Latitude measures how far a location is…
choices: North or south of the equator
East or west of the Prime Meridian
questions.explanation: Latitude is the angular distance north or south of the equator.

questions.prompt: Longitude measures how far a location is…
choices: East or west of the Prime Meridian
North or south of the equator
questions.explanation: Longitude is the angular distance east or west of the Prime Meridian.

questions.prompt: What is the largest ocean on Earth by area?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean.

questions.prompt: What is the largest continent by land area?
questions.explanation: Asia is the largest continent by land area and population.

questions.prompt: How many continents are commonly recognized in the 7‑continent model?
questions.explanation: A common convention lists: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, South America, and Australia/Oceania.

questions.prompt: What is the highest mountain above sea level?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is the highest mountain above mean sea level.

questions.prompt: Which country has the largest land area?
questions.explanation: Russia is the largest country by total area.

questions.prompt: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo is Japan’s capital and largest metropolitan area.

questions.prompt: On a map, what does the scale describe?
choices: The relationship between map distance and real distance
questions.explanation: Map scale tells you how a distance on the map corresponds to a distance in the real world.

questions.prompt: This blank outline is mainly used to show…
choices: Global location (where things are on Earth)
questions.explanation: World maps are used to show locations and spatial relationships at a global scale.

questions.prompt: The Equator divides Earth into the…
questions.explanation: The Equator is the boundary between north and south hemispheres.

questions.prompt: Time zones exist mainly because Earth…
choices: Rotates, so local solar time varies by longitude
questions.explanation: Different longitudes face the Sun at different times due to rotation.

questions.prompt: GPS is mainly used to determine…
questions.explanation: GPS calculates position from satellite timing signals.

questions.prompt: A common problem with map projections is that they…
choices: Show the Earth as perfectly flat
questions.explanation: Projecting a sphere onto a flat surface always introduces distortion.

questions.prompt: The largest desert on Earth (by area) is…
questions.explanation: Antarctica is a cold desert with extremely low precipitation.

questions.prompt: Which river is often cited as one of the two longest in the world (depending on measurement)?
questions.explanation: The Nile is commonly listed among the longest rivers (often compared with the Amazon).

questions.prompt: The Tropic of Cancer is located at about…
questions.explanation: It marks the northernmost latitude where the Sun can be directly overhead.

questions.prompt: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital city of Australia.
